Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lariatin B (natural AMPs; lactam; class 2 lasso peptide; bacteriocins, acid-fast Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXJ; UCSB1a;)
Sequence Information.Source: Rhodococcus jostii K01-B0171, Yunnan, China, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: only the C-terminal three residues differ from Lariatin A.Activity: Active against Gram-positive M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis.Structure:  Although not determined, the structure may be predicted as being similar to lariatin A. Updated 12/2023
Literature Information.Author: Iwatsuki M, Tomoda H, Uchida R, Gouda H, Hirono S, Omura S.2006
Literature Information.Title: Lariatins, antimycobacterial peptides produced by Rhodococcus sp. K01-B0171, have a lasso structure
